content.rendered:
Photo via New Lungs For Me

Remembering Jesse Petersen.

Jesse Petersen, 1978-2017

I’m sure that most, if not all, of you reading this have already heard the sad news about Jesse Petersen’s passing on Wednesday after his brave battle with cystic fibrosis.

It is a mark of the respect and love in which he was held by the community, to see so many tributes to the man on Twitter, Facebook and elsewhere.

1/ My heart breaks to hear of the loss of a good friend @jpetersen. He truly was one of the good guys.

— Brian Gardner (@bgardner) July 6, 2017

Jesse was a prominent member of the #genesiswp community, and doing amazing things in life – I'm so sad he's gone.https://t.co/1CeLLJ6cQ7

— Gary Jones (@GaryJ) July 6, 2017

I am better off having known you, Jesse. Godspeed.@jpetersen #gonetoosoon https://t.co/QIJT0IwN0b

— Susan Ramsey (@onehappystudio) July 5, 2017

I have no words. I’m heartbroken. Prayers to @jpetersen’s family. See you on the other side. https://t.co/jKzZt2JQq9 #genesiswp

— Mike Hemberger (@JiveDig) July 5, 2017

Such sad news. I didn't expect anything to be able to stop him. I enjoyed our early #genesiswp days. RIP friend. https://t.co/DFxG4OQ7ab

— Brandon Kraft (@Kraft) July 5, 2017

My heart hurts for @jpetersen and his entire family… He contributed a great deal to the WordPress community & is already missed

— Jennifer Bourn (@jenniferbourn) July 5, 2017

Met @jpetersen on multiple occasions. Family man and proud dad. Always respected the hell outta that. See you on the flip side, buddy.

— Jared Atchison (@jaredatch) July 5, 2017

Through tears, I ask for retweets, likes, shares, all of it. https://t.co/i6AY06Jn3S

— Ben Meredith (@benUNC) July 5, 2017

Gone, but not lost: In remembrance of Jesse Petersen https://t.co/VfiVyzRLUX #RIPJesse

— Post Status (@post_status) July 6, 2017

I’m not sure what I can add to those, particularly to those who knew him in person.

So I’ll just say that I was lucky enough to know Jesse from the first few months I started playing around with Genesis around five or six years ago.

I had no clue what I was doing, but that even though I was a ‘nobody’ in the community and he was a Genesis contributor, preferred developer and all round Genesis rockstar, he was decent enough to follow me back on Twitter.

I remember the great WordSesh presentation he did in what was the middle of the night for him (on his time zone).

Starting a #GenesisWP tribe with him in Clash of Clans (we were the only two members).

And, most recently, after sending my newsletter every week getting an ‘out of office’ message from Jesse with a clear note in it about the days and hours you should expect a reply from him.

And it always makes me smile because I know how organised he is in his business about setting client expectations and all those other things I should take more care of myself. So even though it was just an out of office message, it was a little bit of Jesse’s personality in my inbox every week.

Out of office message or not, every time I send this weekly newsletter from now on I’ll be thinking of him.

Please help if you can

Jesse was 38 and survived by his wife and two children. As a cystic fibrosis sufferer Jesse was unable to get life insurance so a fund has been set up to help his family.

If you’d like to help Jesse’s family you can do so via the fund.

Please consider helping Jesse's family – his wife and two young boys need our help: https://t.co/Xf599mFemG#GenesisWP #WordPress https://t.co/4afv3PP36P

— Susan Ramsey (@onehappystudio) July 5, 2017

RIP Jesse, you did everything that you could.

I’m glad to call you a friend.

Can you look over your life and say you’d be leaving those connected to you better off having known you? If not, start today.

— Jesse Ⓦ Petersen (@jpetersen) July 3, 2017

Themes

Matt Whiteley launches DinePro (demo), a new restaurant theme for Genesis built with Advanced Custom Fields.

Introducing DinePro! A #wordpress #restaurant theme built with #acf one the #genesiswp framework!https://t.co/z85QCMGY9z pic.twitter.com/l1zkmkPyw6

— Matt Whiteley (@whiteleydesigns) July 7, 2017

Seo Themes’ Studio Pro theme is now available on StudioPress.

Studio Pro: A Slick, Creative Theme for Your Agency https://t.co/HX59QCQ2En via @StudioPress #genesiswp #WordPress #SEO

— Seo Themes (@seothemeswp) July 6, 2017

Looks like they’ll be a new theme coming soon for StudioPress, courtesy of Brian Gardner and Rafal Tomal!

Current status: at Starbucks with @RafalTomal designing the next @studiopress theme. #genesiswp

— Brian Gardner (@bgardner) July 6, 2017

Showcase

Patricia Alix Villa with a new site for mimiebichievents.com

So excited to announce the launch of https://t.co/SxOMCBBru3! #genesiswp #webdesign #wordpress pic.twitter.com/lLpNMyekbs

— Patricia Alix Villa (@PatFancyGirl) July 8, 2017

Podcasts

The Genesis community’s very own Srdihar Katakam was on WP Bosses this week.

Watch the replay of Episode 15 with Sridhar Katakam @srikathttps://t.co/U0ijyMKOx7#WordPress #WPBosses #WPAustralia #GenesisWP #Hangout

— WP Bosses (@wpbosses) July 5, 2017

Best of the rest

Sridhar Katakam launches another of his ‘functionality themes’, Floating Header on Featured Image.

[Functionality Theme] Floating Header on Featured Image:https://t.co/ezCmxii61l#GenesisWP pic.twitter.com/o3VksY2kIt

— Sridhar Katakam (@srikat) July 7, 2017

If you haven’t read and / or heard it yet you might want to check out the new Sites newsletter and podcast from StudioPress.blog.

We’re taking https://t.co/XKawBO02Of to the next level. Check out the new podcast and newsletter! #genesiswp

— Rafal Tomal (@RafalTomal) July 6, 2017
